result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Freedom Linn Philippi

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  No leaving the State of Wisconsin without court approval.  Curfew of 11pm-7am except for employment or treatment purposes.

2:16 PM Defendant Freedom Linn Philippi appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Freedom Linn Philippi.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def appearing from Bayfield County Jail.  Off the record 2:17 PM.  Back on the record 2:22 PM, same appearances as previously noted.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Atty Erdman asks to be heard on bond.  Court notes she amended bond at last hearing.  Atty Erdman argues to modify to signature bond.  Def indicates she can post $250 cash.  State agrees to modify, but wants no leaving WI without approval and curfew of 11pm-7am except for treatment or employment purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Court amends bond to $250 cash with the conditions requested by the State.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

1:33 PM Defendant Freedom Linn Philippi appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. PD's office has not been able to locate an attorney for the defendant as of yet.  Court will allow def to argue for bond reduction.  Def states she can post $250 cash.  Atty Schmidt notes he has a conflict, can't comment.  Court amends bond to $500 cash, same conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:18 PM Defendant Freedom Linn Philippi appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def appears from Bayfield County Jail.  Case on for initial appearance.  Def has applied for PD, one has not yet been appointed.  Court explains def's options- to move forward today or to reset the initial appearance so def can obtain counsel.  Def asks to reset for counsel.  Bond continues.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
